message: Disappointed that both nominees for Deputy & Associate Attorney General refused to commit to protecting transgender students under Title IX. The only appropriate answer to this question is yes.

Companies use mandatory arbitration to limit consumers' ability to seek recourse on problems with common products like my Fitbit to investments like a college education. Today, I joined a number of my colleagues to introduce several bills to tell companies that they can't force customers into mandatory arbitration.
The past two months have shown that battles don't stay won. But we will keep fighting. #DayWithoutWomen #InternationalWomensDay

Instead of debating how best to expand access, Republicans are fighting with each other to see just how many people they can kick off insurance rolls – all in a crusade to save money. #Trumpcare is not a crusade to improve the lives of as many Americans as possible. It is a crusade to service their radical, anti-government ideology.
No matter what distractions the President throws out into the universe, we must stay focused on fighting the GOP's destructive agenda.

In the wake of reports of Marines sharing explicit photos of their female comrades, I pressed Commandant of the Marine Corps General Robert Neller for a commitment to address sexual assault and the mistreatment of women in the Armed Forces.

Judge Watson's ruling is yet another blow to the President's unconstitutional Muslim Ban. President Trump during the campaign made clear his intention to impose a Muslim ban. He has done so and no amount of spinning can obfuscate his intent. Every time our country has targeted a minority group for discriminatory treatment, we have been very wrong, and this Administration's actions are no different. In finding this Executive Order to be unconstitutional, Judge Watson exemplifies the importance of an independent judiciary.

We need a Supreme Court Justice who will represent all Americans, not just the wealthy and corporate interests. That's why I will oppose Neil Gorsuch's nomination.

The President's executive order ending the #CleanPowerPlan is clear proof that this Administration is not committed to an ‘all of the above’ energy strategy. The President continues to promote alternative facts over empirical scientific evidence of climate change and unravel the clean and renewable energy progress that we have made over the past eight years.  While the President can afford to live in this alternate universe, Hawaii and other island communities are forced to grapple with the reality of climate change. Our coral reefs are dying because of historically high ocean temperatures. By 2100, Hawaii’s sea levels will rise by more than three feet. We owe it to our keiki to listen to our climate scientists, and build upon, not erase, the progress we’ve made.
I'm live on the Senate floor, asking you to keep up the activist energy to help Senate Democrats #StopGorsuch.

Republicans in Congress want to make it harder for you to save for retirement.   In Hawaii, the average monthly Social Security benefit is $1,408. Given the costs of housing, medical insurance, and other necessities. that is not nearly enough. And taking away tools that states and local governments can use to help bolster retirement savings makes no sense.

Vice President Pence was just here to break a tie because even Republicans in Congress couldn’t get enough men to tell women what they can do with their bodies. I'm live on the Senate floor with reactions.

The actions of the Roberts Court in Citizens United and Shelby County make clear the stakes of Judge Gorsuch's nomination. The repeated use of chemical weapons by the Assad regime against his own people is an atrocity and breach of international law, and the international community must hold him accountable. The Civil War in Syria adds layers of complexity in a country and region where there are no easy answers and opportunities for missteps are great. In light of this, President Trump must present a coherent strategy for addressing the ongoing situation in Syria, including our own responsibility in confronting the humanitarian catastrophe and refugee crisis.

In consultation with her physician, Senator Mazie Hirono has elected to undergo surgery to implant a lens to improve the vision in her left eye.   Because this surgery requires some preparation, Senator Hirono plans to have this procedure during the Congressional recess, which will allow her to get back to work when the Senate is back in session. She looks forward to a speedy recovery.   “While I’m disappointed that I won’t be able to come home for the current state work period, I’m looking forward to holding town halls on Oahu and Kauai on May 6, and expect to be back at work by the time the Senate reconvenes on April 24,” said Senator Hirono.

The suggestion that being from Hawaii somehow disqualifies Judge Watson from performing his Constitutional duty is dangerous, ignorant, and prejudiced. I am frankly dumbfounded that our nation’s top lawyer would attack our independent judiciary. But we shouldn’t be surprised. This is just the latest in the Trump Administration’s attacks against the very tenets of our Constitution and democracy.

"Jeff Sessions, the attorney general of the United States, appears to need a reminder: Hawaii was granted statehood in 1959. I'm happy to tell him where I was when Hawaii became a state. I was in sixth grade at Koko Head Elementary School in Honolulu, and was chosen to pin the 50th star on the American flag in front of my teachers and classmates at a special assembly to celebrate statehood.  "Like my fellow citizens in Hawaii, I am a proud American. This is why Sessions' ignorant comments about US District Judge Derrick Watson from Hawaii were so insulting and prejudiced."

Federal judges- members of our independent judiciary- are receiving death threats because of rulings that the President disagreed with. I asked FBI Director Comey what he is doing to protect federal judges, and will continue to hold the FBI accountable.

I’m thinking of the thousands of Hawaii residents I’ve heard from who are living in fear of losing their insurance and other protections they’ve received thanks to the Affordable Care Act. Constituents like Kathryn, a teacher and single parent, who is afraid of losing her insurance because of a preexisting condition; and Anne, who gave birth to a healthy baby boy thanks to Medicaid coverage. The fight to save the Affordable Care Act in the Senate starts today. I will stand strong to ensure Trumpcare does not undermine Prepaid Health Care and Affordable Care Act protections for Hawaii families.

LIVE: We're continuing to investigate Russian interference in our democracy. Watch live as I question Sally Yates and James Clapper.

The President’s decision to fire FBI Director James Comey in this manner, under this pretext, and at this time is a total disservice to the American people.  The country is asking, Mr. President, what do you have to hide?  There is no question that President Trump wants the investigation of Russian interference with the 2016 Presidential election, and the Trump team’s ties to those efforts, to just go away.  Knowing this, it is hard to interpret the decision to fire Director Comey as being motivated by anything other than a desire to shut down or derail the FBI’s investigation. In fact, it only raises further suspicions about the Trump team’s ties to Russian interference in our election.  For months, I have called for a special prosecutor and an independent investigation into this serious matter. We need a special prosecutor who will conduct an impartial, thorough investigation untainted by political considerations.
#Trumpcare would hurt millions of American families. We need your stories to help us defeat this bill.

These are unprecedented times, and we can't act like it's business as usual in the Senate. We must come together in a bipartisan way to call for a special prosecutor to investigate the Trump team's ties to Russia.

LIVE: We are learning, practically on an hourly basis, about how the President made his decision to fire Director Comey and why. We need for a special prosecutor with the mandate and authority to follow the facts wherever they lead, free of political considerations.

I joined MSNBC's Chris Jansing to talk about the importance of appointing a special prosecutor to conduct an independent, thorough investigation into the Russia/Trump matter.
Happy Mother's Day to my mom Laura & all moms celebrating today!
Jeff Sessions' directive to charge drug offenders at the highest level sets back bipartisan efforts to enact sentencing reform.

During a routine pre-operative physical for my eye surgery, my doctor discovered an abnormality on my chest x-ray. After a series of follow up tests, I have been diagnosed with kidney cancer that is also present in my seventh rib.  My treatment is being overseen by one of the preeminent kidney cancer specialists in the country at Medstar Georgetown University Hospital. He has designed a comprehensive treatment plan – including surgery to remove my right kidney and an innovative, non-invasive, outpatient procedure called Cyberknife to eradicate the lesion on my rib. At the conclusion of this treatment, there will be no identifiable disease left untreated. My doctor expects I will make a full recovery from these treatments.  I will continue working during my recovery, and look forward to returning to the Senate as soon as possible.   I face this fight with the same determination I’ve fought for the people of Hawaii. And I never quit, especially when things get tough.  I appreciate your support and good wishes, and look forward to getting back to the Senate to continue fighting for Hawaii as soon as possible.
Just in from Senator Hirono- "Got out of surgery and doing okay! Thank you everyone for the well wishes!"  -Staff
I'm back at work today to vote in the Senate. It's meant so much to me to hear from so many friends throughout the past week. Mahalo nui.

President Trump’s budget is dangerous for Hawaii families. It dismantles Medicaid, breaks his promise not to cut Social Security, eliminates Native Hawaiian programs, slashes food stamps and other support for working families, guts federal education programs, and defunds federal investments that create local jobs. I will fight tooth and nail in opposition to these dangerous and devastating cuts to programs Hawaii families depend on every day.
Kimchi is the new kale! My kimchi recipe won the the healthiest recipe award at the March of Dimes Gourmet Gala.

Today, we pay respect to the men and women who served faithfully in our Armed Services and gave the ultimate sacrifice on behalf of our country. Memorial Day also serves as a poignant reminder for the loss a family endures when a member of their ohana is taken in service to the nation. We share their grief as they mourn those who have passed while in service.

Kahului Airport and Hilo International Airport will receive more than $10 million in funding from the FAA so that airports in Hawaii can strengthen their runway safety and operations. Ensuring safe and secure air travel is critical to sustaining Hawaii’s economy and commerce.

President Trump’s decision to withdraw the United States from the Paris Climate Agreement is irresponsible, hasty, and short-sighted. In Hawaii we understand why it’s important to take care of our land, ocean, and air – our way of life depends on it. Today, it’s more important than ever for states like Hawaii to boldly take the lead on clean energy innovation and good stewardship of our aina.
Mahalo to the KITV news team for the Morning Shaka this AM for new federal funding to support recruitment of new STEM teachers in Hawaii.

At a time when we have so many concerns about President Trump’s interference with the FBI’s investigation of his team’s ties with Russia, it is critical that our next FBI director remains fiercely independent of the White House. By his own admission, Donald Trump fired the former FBI Director, James Comey, with the hope it would bring the Russia investigation to an end. In doing so, the President forfeited any benefit of the doubt with this nomination. I will be looking closely to see if Donald Trump’s nominee Chris Wray will approach the responsibilities of the job seriously and free of politics. His loyalty pledge must be to the Constitution and the country, not to Donald Trump.
AARP Hawaii was on the Hill today to oppose #Trumpcare. I spoke with Barbara Kim Stanton about how devastating the Republican proposal will be to Hawaii families.

Just a few minutes ago, Andres Magana Ortiz was scheduled to report to ICE in Honolulu to be deported from his home of nearly 30 years. Secretary Kelly, I renew our call once more: Let Andres stay in our country. Let his children have a father present and active in their lives. It’s not too late to keep this family together.

This past weekend, I met a father who asked me how he could tell his son it was wrong to lie with Donald Trump as President. Since last November, we’ve all had to wrestle with how to instill good values in our communities when the president of the United States seems to demonstrate such contempt for them. I discussed my take with the American Constitution Society for Law and Policy today.

Today, we honored the legacy of King Kamehameha in the U.S. Capitol. We have a proud history in Hawaii of people coming together and fighting for each other. As we honor King Kamehameha, we must continue together, in solidarity, to advocate for our state.

Court after court has seen this Muslim Ban for what it is: an illegal attack on a group of individuals singled out for their religion. Today is a victory not only for Hawaii, but for our shared American values. The decision is a welcome reminder that the federal courts serve an invaluable function in our system of checks and balances.   Although President’s Trump’s cabinet may think otherwise, today’s ruling affirms that judges in Hawaii are more than capable of applying our laws and Constitution to President Trump’s dangerous policies. I’m proud that my home state has shown leadership in fighting against President Trump’s Muslim Ban.

Today we pause to remember the 49 people who lost their lives at Pulse nightclub and reflect on the battles still ahead in our pursuit of full equality for every American. I was honored to share the following message this weekend. #HonorThemWithAction
Every year Orchid Lei Company brings thousands of lei for #HawaiiOnTheHill. Learn more about Sukit and his family at this year's #HawaiiOnTheHill tomorrow.
Mahalo to the KITV news team for the Morning Shaka. I will continue to do everything in my power to protect Social Security, Medicare, and Medicaid for seniors in Hawaii and across the country.

Today, the Senate Indian Affairs Committee heard a bill that would eliminate federal Native Hawaiian housing programs. The BUIILD Act strikes a blow not only to the 37,000 Native Hawaiians who would benefit from their inclusion, but also over 500,000 Native Hawaiians in our country. But this is about much more than just stripping out Native Hawaiian housing programs from a bill. At a time when we see "us against them" perspectives rising in our country, we cannot allow "divide and conquer" tactics to undermine collaborative efforts to bring people together.
It's more important than ever that Hawaii's business community connect directly with news and policy makers. Watch our #HawaiiontheHill Policy Summit live.
My thoughts are with Rep. Scalise, Congressional staff, and Capitol Police officers. Mahalo to brave first responders who protect us every day.

Given the uncertainties of the current administration, it has become more important than ever that Hawaii’s business community knows the D.C. landscape and can advocate for themselves. I’m pleased that in our fourth year of Hawaii on the Hill we were able to connect nearly 70 local businesses with top officials. #HawaiiontheHill

Today, we welcomed nearly 75 members of Hawaii’s business community to Capitol Hill for the Fourth Annual Hawaii on the Hill Policy Summit. Business leaders representing diverse industries – including manufacturing, health care, transportation, and others – participated in the event.
The Aloha Spirit was in Washington, DC today. Mahalo to all who attended #HawaiiontheHill!

Tonight, at the Fourth Annual Taste of Hawaii on Capitol Hill we celebrated the success of nearly 70 participating Hawaii businesses with over 1,600 attendees. They were greeted with fresh orchid lei from the Orchard Lei Company, and learned more about doing business in Hawaii and the Aloha Spirit. #HawaiiontheHill
Some highlights from last night's event at #HawaiiontheHill. Mahalo to all those who attended!

A sweet way to wrap up #HawaiiontheHill week- sharing Lappert's Hawaii, Diamond Bakery Co., Ltd., Hawaiian Chip Company, and the Aloha Spirit with our Senate ohana.

Welcome home Hokulea & Hikianalia! Wish I could be there in person to celebrate the  Polynesian Voyaging Society's accomplishment of spreading the message of #MalamaHonua around the world, including in Washington, D.C. last year.

The Trump budget zeros out funding to preserve Hawaii's fragile ecosystems and protect our water resources under our federal "Island Forests at Risk" proposal. So I asked Interior Secretary Ryan Zinke how he can justify cutting these critical programs while prioritizing fossil fuel extraction.

President Trump & Mitch McConnell are pushing through a health care bill that would give massive tax cuts to the mega-rich at the expense of seniors and families who would lose access to health care. We can't let him get away with hurting millions and millions of Americans.

Right now 13 of my male colleagues are sequestered away somewhere, plotting how to deprive millions of women across our country access to essential health care. I sat down with KITV Island News' Paula Akana in Washington, D.C. to announce a positive change in my battle with kidney cancer and to discuss the fights ahead in the Senate.

Mitch McConnell and Donald Trump can try to jam this bill down our throats, but we aren’t going to let them succeed and they will be held accountable.

On the 45th anniversary of Title IX, we celebrate my friend Patsy Mink's legacy of creating educational opportunity for women and girls across our country.  But more work remains. That's why I introduced the Patsy T. Mink Gender Equity in Education Act, which provides additional resources to fully implement this watershed law.
#Trumpcare isn't health care- it's a tax cut for the wealthiest in our country on the backs of the poorest, oldest, and sickest. That's why we must continue to speak out against this "mean" bill.

Today, the Senate Veterans' Affairs Committee heard testimony in support of my & U.S. Senator Susan Collins' bipartisan bill to protect nursing home coverage for veterans in Hawaii and across the country. In February, I visited Hale Makua Health Services on Maui which operates the only two free standing nursing homes on the island and would be impacted by a lapse in the program. Wes Lo, Hale Makua’s CEO, said that passing the bill is needed so that more veterans on Maui will be able to receive around the clock nursing care and supervision.

Joining the People's Filibuster against Trumpcare. We have to keep up the fight against this mean, ugly bill.
Strengthening the safety and well-being of our traveling public, this FAA funding will help enhance airport operations and runway safety at the Lihue, Kahului, and Molokai airports.
We cannot sit idly by as #Trumpcare continues to threaten Hawaii families, especially the oldest, poorest, and sickest in our communities.

This NOAA funding supports local research that will increase climate change resiliency on Hawaii’s coasts. I’m committed to investing in the science that will inform preparedness, response, and planning for the future of our coastal communities.

My heart goes out to my friend Senator John McCain tonight, and I'm wishing him the very best in his fight with cancer.

This announcement is long overdue for our veterans on Maui and Kauai. I remain committed to working with the VA to strengthen its commitment to improving communication and services for veterans in Hawaii.

A year after his passing, thinking of my younger brother Mark Takai. Mark gave back to his community for his entire life, and his fighting spirit lives on in his sister Nadine and the entire Takai family who are still working to end pancreatic cancer. My thoughts are with all of them today.

Today, we heard from a number of nominees in the Senate Energy and Natural Resources Committee, including nominees who could work on endangered species protection and upholding our moral obligation to FAS citizens. Celebrating being home in Hawaii with a bowl of vegetarian ramen! Looking forward to seeing many of you over the Senate's state work period.

Fifty-two years ago, the Voting Rights Act made the right to vote a reality for millions of Americans. However, the Supreme Court’s decision in Shelby County gutted this seminal law and threatened the progress of generations of Civil Right heroes—it also gave numerous states a free pass to enact onerous voter ID laws and other barriers that particularly impact communities of color. We must act to restore the Voting Rights Act and protect the fundamental right of all Americans to vote and have their vote counted.

Our first priority must be to keep Hawaii and our country safe, and I have confidence in Admiral Harris and our commanders in the region. De-escalating tensions with North Korea will require sustained engagement and steady American leadership. At the same time, we must work toward a comprehensive and sustainable diplomatic solution in concert with our allies and other regional partners. Bluster and saber-rattling will only exacerbate an already difficult situation.

Congratulations to the Pearl Harbor Naval Shipyard Class of 2017 graduates! We need workers like you to maintain, repair, and overhaul the ships and submarines in our fleet. We will work together to make sure that the Pearl Harbor Naval Shipyard remains a strong and vital part of our national security.

‪We must stand up to a culture where white supremacists feel empowered to march down streets with weapons and commit horrendous acts of violence. The President should stop using divisive rhetoric and forcefully condemn white supremacist groups that provoke and practice violence.

Great to meet with Superintendent Christina Kishimoto today. Looking forward to continuing conversations about our ongoing commitment for quality education for Hawaii students.

Honored to meet with Filipino World War II veterans this weekend. I continue to work with The Filipino Veterans Recognition and Education Project to see through efforts to recognize these brave soldiers at a Congressional Gold Medal Award Ceremony.
On the 5th anniversary of DACA’s implementation, we must  #DefendDACA so DREAMers can keep contributing to the country they love.

The President continues to walk back his condemnation of violence-prone white supremacist groups. It’s clear that this President does not serve all Americans. Bringing our country together will be up to each of us; he will be no help.

Earlier this week, I attended the ALA Hawaii Food Show, which gives local companies the opportunity to place their products in our military marketplace. Proud that starting next year, the show will be renamed for my friend, Senator Daniel Akaka.

Kupu interns and alumni are working to protect our aina and Hawaii's native plants and animals. I will continue to advocate for AmeriCorps funding that supports programs like KUPU that help train Hawaii’s workforce and provide career pathways for young conservationists.

It will take all of us working together to protect programs that benefit the Native Hawaiian community, including the Native Hawaiian small business program. I spoke to the Native Hawaiian Organizations Association on why these initiatives are important:
Great catching up with Paula Akana over acai bowls with fresh paʻiʻai after a morning walk in Kapiolani Park!

In a 21st century economy, using social media to promote Hawaii’s small businesses is a necessity. Mahalo to the more than 200 Hilo entrepreneurs who joined us this morning to learn how to start up or improve their use of social media to expand their reach and grow their businesses. #fbboost
We're live at #fbboost Honolulu with Chamber of Commerce Hawaii's Lori Abe. Join us as we discuss how we can support Hawaii's small businesses!
I'm with Hawaii Attorney General Doug Chin and immigration advocates calling on the President to save DACA
We're working to #DefendDACA for the hundreds of thousands of young people who came forward in good faith to pursue their dreams in the only country they know.

Military-connected students face unique challenges in adjusting to a new school. We heard from military-connected students about how Joint Venture Education Forum's partnerships have helped their studies and transition to a new school.

I welcome William Bradford’s resignation from his position as the Director of the Office of Indian Energy. His many offensive online statements, including that the internment of 120,000 Japanese-Americans during World War II was "necessary" are truly beyond the pale, especially as he was appointed to lead an office that serves minority communities.  It remains deeply troubling, however, that Bradford is only one of a number of top Trump administration officials with a history of racist and misogynistic views. Secretary Perry has still not provided me with an explanation of how Bradford cleared the Department of Energy’s vetting process despite his repugnant online history. I expect these answers to be forthcoming from the Department.

After months of empty rhetoric to the contrary, the President took the cruel and unnecessary step to eliminate DACA – exposing more than 800,000 young people to deportation. They are not criminals. They are inspiring young people aptly called DREAMers because of their dream of making a better life for themselves in the only country they know.  Ending DACA is the latest step this President has taken to attack minority communities and stoke the fear and divisiveness that served as pillars of his campaign and inform his presidency.  DACA is clearly constitutional. But by rescinding the program, the President puts the onus on Congress to act. Congress must take appropriate action to provide permanent legal status to DREAMers.   I want to be clear: I reject any effort to hold these young people hostage for an unnecessary waste of money like Donald Trump’s wall. I will continue to stand with these inspiring young people and groups all across the country to fight this latest cruel and totally unjustifiable action by the President.

Sadly, I am not surprised that the President chose to end #DACA. His continued attacks on minorities and immigrants are unjustifiable. But he continues to do it. Why? To play to his white supremacist base.

Since the President has kicked the ball to Congress to protect DREAMers, something he could and should have done himself, Congress must step up and do just that. Congress must step up because we cannot count on the President to do the right thing by exerting consistent, comprehensive, or moral leadership. #HeretoStay

We are all one diagnosis away from a major illness. When that time comes, no one should have to worry about whether they can afford the care that might save their life. I support universal, affordable, accessible, quality health care as a right, not a privilege. A single payer, Medicare for All system is a strong articulation of this principle, which is why I support Senator Sanders' bill. There are other strong proposals that will put us on a path to a single payer system. I will support proposals that reaffirm the principle that universal health care is a right, not a privilege.

Republicans are living in an alternative universe. This bill gives over $1 trillion in tax cuts to the richest one percent of individuals and corporations in our country, while eliminating health insurance coverage for more than 13 million Americans and raising the premiums for everyone else, and setting the stage for massive cuts to Medicare, Medicaid, and Social Security—all to pay for this huge giveaway for corporations and the mega-rich like Donald Trump. Today, I am calling on my colleague Al Franken to step aside. I’ve struggled with this decision because he’s been a good Senator and I consider him a friend. But that cannot excuse his behavior and his mistreatment of women.  TIME Magazine, by naming ‘The Silence Breakers’ as their ‘Person of the Year,’ is recognizing what women have always known: there are men among us who use their positions of power and influence to manipulate, harass, and assault women. What is new here is the women.  We are, all of us, speaking out, naming names and demanding that the harassers take responsibility for their behavior.  I am proud of each of the women who has come forward, and heartened by the changing climate that has received their stories with acceptance and compassion.  My hope is that this moment for a cultural change will result in women no longer being viewed as objects or toys, but recognized for their abilities and achievements. As regular human beings. Women have endured this behavior, which for too long has been ignored and tolerated. But no longer.  We can only create a culture where women are respected as equals if we all step forward and be part of the change by holding everyone, especially our leaders, accountable.

For the past 50 years, our seniors have approached retirement with the peace of mind knowing that Medicare will be there for them. The Affordable Care Act is part of the commitment we’ve made to care for and honor our kupuna. In 2014, the Affordable Care Act saved Hawaii seniors more than $4 million in Medicare costs. It has also extended the life of Medicare by a decade.  Today, Republicans in Congress voted to advance a resolution they plan to use to dismantle the ACA. Top Republicans, including the President-elect’s nominee for Secretary of Health and Human Services are proposing drastic changes to Medicare that would end this crucial safety net as we know it.  I will do everything in my power to protect these benefits for families across Hawaii.
I will fight tooth and nail efforts to defund Planned Parenthood or take away a woman's right to choose

Live at 12:45 p.m. EST- I'll be making an important announcement on the nomination of Jeff Sessions to serve as Attorney General. Watch this space.  EDIT: My full remarks in opposition to Senator Sessions' nomination follow:  I’ve served with Jeff Sessions throughout my time in the Senate and respect him as a colleague.   But I have deep concerns about how Senator Sessions would use his prosecutorial discretion as Attorney General to address a number of critical issues.   During his confirmation hearing, I pressed Senator Sessions for a commitment to vigorously protect every citizen’s right to vote, particularly with regard to Section 2 of the Voting Rights Act – which safeguards Americans from discriminatory voting laws.   He did not give me a satisfactory answer that he would scrutinize voting laws for discriminatory effect.   I also asked Senator Sessions whether he would honor the Department of Justice’s consent decrees that address police misconduct and enhance accountability.   Senator Sessions did not adequately assure me that his Department would uphold these agreements without revisiting or renegotiating these agreements. I pressed Senator Sessions for a commitment to defend Roe v. Wade in federal court and to enforce laws that guarantee the constitutionally-protected right to choose.    Senator Sessions did not disavow his past comments that Roe v. Wade was one of the worst Supreme Court cases ever decided.  Should the Supreme Court be presented with a case that provides them the opportunity to overturn Roe v. Wade, I asked him what he would direct his Solicitor General to do. He said this was hypothetical and didn’t respond.  Over the past two months, I’ve heard from hundreds of my constituents and a number of prominent civil rights organizations – including a number who testified yesterday – on this issue.   I will vote against the nomination of Jeff Sessions to serve as Attorney General because I am deeply concerned about how he would use his prosecutorial discretion to uphold voting rights, protect civil rights, and protect a woman’s right to choose.
LIVE at 12:45 p.m. EST- I'll be making an important announcement on the nomination of Jeff Sessions to serve as Attorney General.

Earlier today, I announced that I will oppose the nomination of Jeff Sessions to serve as Attorney General. I am deeply concerned about how he would use his prosecutorial discretion to uphold voting rights, protect civil rights, and protect a woman’s right to choose.

Today, I voted against the nomination of Mike Pompeo to serve as Director of the Central Intelligence Agency. Representative Pompeo has been wrong on many critical intelligence issues during his 6 years in Congress.   He won’t disavow his past support of torture. He opposed the release of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence’s torture report. He has advocated for reinstating mass surveillance of American citizens. He recently left the door open to outsourcing surveillance of American citizens to foreign governments to circumvent existing laws. He opposes the closure of Guantanamo. He opposes the Iran nuclear agreement.  Congressman Pompeo is the wrong person to the lead the Central Intelligence Agency.

ATTENTION: Immigrants and Refugees from Iraq, Syria, Iran, Libya, Somalia, Sudan and Yemen:  YOU HAVE RIGHTS.  If you are denied entry or detained at a port of entry by a Customs and Border Protection here's what you should do:  Green Card Holders: Resist any demands to give up your green card. Do NOT sign Form I-407, even if they say it will make things easier.  Demand a hearing from a judge: You have the right to a hearing with an immigration judge. Do NOT relinquish this right.  Demand to Speak to an Attorney: You have the right to be represented by an attorney. Ask to speak to an attorney, and discuss details of your case with only your attorney, not CBP.  SHARE THIS INFORMATION WITH ALL VULNERABLE GROUPS.

In his first two weeks as President, Donald Trump has demonstrated minimal tolerance for independent thinking and dissent. I am deeply concerned that his choice for the Supreme Court, Judge Neil Gorsuch, will be a rubber stamp for the President's radical agenda. We owe it to the American people to vet this nominee extensively and exhaustively. In the weeks and months ahead, I will carefully scrutinize Judge Gorsuch's judicial philosophy, his views on a woman's constitutional right to an abortion, his position on voting rights, and his thoughts on the balance between individual rights and corporate power, among other subjects.

"I have a responsibility to the public to question Judge Gorsuch's record, his attitude, how he would go about making decisions. Of course, President Trump has already shown he doesn't like people who disagree with him."

In the weeks and months ahead, I will carefully and extensively scrutinize Judge Neil Gorsuch’s record. I will question him on his judicial philosophy and how he interprets the constitution. I will insist he clarify his position on a woman’s constitutionally-protected right to choose, on voting rights, and the appropriate balance between corporate interests and individual rights. I will do my job as United States Senator, and the American people deserve nothing less from us.

I'm opposing the nomination of #pollutingPruitt & will be on the Senate floor tomorrow morning to urge my colleagues to do the same.

#PollutingPruitt's record paints a clear picture: his priorities directly conflict with the EPA’s mission to protect public health and the environment. He is much more concerned about protecting corporate interests than keeping our communities healthy and safe from pollution. I will oppose his nomination.

The internment of Japanese Americans during World War II remains a dark period in our nation’s history. Whenever our country has targeted a particular ethnicity, race, national origin, or religion for discriminatory treatment, we have been very deeply wrong. But today, we are seeing the same discriminatory treatment with President Trump’s targeting of refugees, immigrants, and the Muslim community. I will continue to fight these actions, and will reintroduce a resolution in the Senate recognizing the significance of Executive Order 9066, and affirming that we must stand up for the civil rights of all. #DayofRemembrance #EO9066

ICYMI: Senator Catherine Cortez Masto, Senator Dick Durbin, and I introduced legislation to reverse President Trump’s executive order that targets nearly 8 million undocumented immigrant families for deportation.

Congratulations to Trinity Christian School's Rayla Okasaki for winning Hawaii's Doodle4Google competition! Looking forward to voting for Rayla's doodle as she competes as part of a national contest to be featured on the Google homepage.

My message on Hawaii News Now this morning: I'm fighting alongside the millions of people in Hawaii and across our country who are speaking out against all the terrible things the Trump Administration is doing. Please continue to stay engaged, and continue to contact me. #Resist
In Hawaii, we know the importance of protecting our aina. Proud to have voted with the League of Conservation Voters 100% of the time in 2016. #LCVScorecard

I visited Haleakala National Park last November, where park rangers saved the Haleakala silversword from near extinction. Under Ryan Zinke's leadership, I doubt that the U.S. Department of the Interior would remain committed to conservation & public lands. #publiclandsproud

With this President, I pay attention to what he does more than what he says because in his first month in office, Donald Trump’s actions have not lived up to the clichés he delivered tonight. He stands by executive orders that have spread fear and chaos throughout the country. Tonight he called for repealing the Affordable Care Act and replacing it with rhetoric. He also clearly called for school vouchers, and in this he has the right Education Secretary who does not believe in public education. For all his rhetoric about national security and American interests, he had absolutely nothing to say about getting to the bottom of Russian interference with our democracy. No matter what the President said tonight, I remain resolved to resist his dangerous, divisive actions.

Planned Parenthood Votes Northwest and Hawaii activsts are in the Capitol today sending a strong message to my Republican colleagues that funding cuts would be devastating to millions across the country. #StandwithPP
The Attorney General made the correct decision to recuse himself, but it is not sufficient. We need an independent investigation into the Trump administration’s ties to the Russian government.

Hawaii projects have made so much progress over the past 8 years to embrace a clean and renewable energy future. Rick Perry and the Trump administration would work to reverse this progress and take us backward.

I would welcome Jeff Sessions' resignation as Attorney General. But we need to get to the bottom of Russia's interference in our democracy -- starting with Jeff Sessions coming back to the Judiciary Committee to testify under oath & continuing with an independent investigation.

The President's new executive order is still basically a Muslim ban. It's still a ban based on one's religion, and every time our country has targeted a minority group for discriminatory treatment, we have been proven to be very, very wrong, and the President is wrong in this instance. #NoBanNoWallNoRaids
